item.title: 'Dawson's Creek' star James Van Der Beek has died at 48

item.title: Life, liberty and the very American pursuit of humor
item.description: The Declaration of Independence states that all men have certain "unalienable rights." From Mark Twain to Jon Stewart, satirists have picked apart that guarantee and what politicians do to honor it.

item.title: Students' push for change results in new Latino history exhibit in Chicago
item.description: A group of Latino high school students in Chicago didn't feel represented by a local museum. They successfully petitioned the museum, resulting in a new exhibit reflecting local Latino history.

item.title: A daughter reexamines her own family story in 'The Mixed Marriage Project'
item.description: Dorothy Roberts' parents, a white anthropologist and a Black woman from Jamaica, spent years interviewing interracial couples in Chicago. Her memoir draws from their records.

item.description: Curators and museum leadership typically form and select exhibits. It was high school students though that helped change an exhibit about Latino culture in Chicago. Aqui en Chicago is now open.

item.title: Double Dutch is having a moment
item.description: Double Dutch is experiencing a comeback. The jump rope style, which involves two ropes turned in opposite directions, has been kept alive in the Black community.
